title: The Impact of degree of internationalization of German based global family businesses towards financial performance
abstract: Existing studies explaining the relationship between Degree of Internationalization and Financial Performance has generated non-conclusive result. Highlighting the importance of institutional context and multidimensionality of Degree of internationalization as the possible reasons of such result, this research uses 9 German Based Global Family Businesses for the period of2010-2014 as the sample in order to find the "right" relationship between the two concepts. Using simple and multiple linear regression analysis, this research aims to examine whether Degree of Internationalization has significant influence towards Financial performance in the scope of German Based Global Family Businesses. Also, this research seeks to find which factor of German Based Global Family Businesses' Degree of Internationalization influences their Financial Performance the most. The findings of this research indicate two things. First, Degree of Internationalization of German Based Global Family Businesses has positive significant influence towards Financial Performance Second, Foreign Asset to Total Asset ratio is the significantly most influencing factor of German Based Global Family Businesses' Degree of internationalization.
contributors: Ricky Wang (Advisor 1); Liem Pei Fun, S.E., M.Com. (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 34010246/MAN/2016; Dicky Kuswandy Onggano (34412063)
